#Text=Edgar Allan Poe
#Text=The thousand injuries of Fortunato
#Text=I had borne as I best could , but when he ventured upon insult , I vowed revenge .
#Text=You , who so well know the nature of my soul , will not suppose , however , that I gave utterance to a threat .
#Text=At length I would be avenged ; this was a point definitely settled -- but the very definitiveness with which it was resolved , precluded the idea of risk .
#Text=I must not only punish , but punish with impunity .
#Text=A wrong is unredressed when retribution overtakes its redresser .
#Text=It is equally unredressed when the avenger fails to make himself felt as such to him who has done the wrong .
#Text=It must be understood that neither by word nor deed had I given Fortunato cause to doubt my good will .
#Text=I continued , as was my wont , to smile in his face , and he did not perceive that my smile now was at the thought of his immolation .
#Text=He had a weak point -- this Fortunato -- although in other regards he was a man to be respected and even feared .
#Text=He prided himself on his connoisseurship in wine .
#Text=Few Italians have the true virtuoso spirit .
#Text=For the most part their enthusiasm is adopted to suit the time and opportunity -- to practise imposture upon the British and Austrian millionaires .
#Text=In painting and gemmary , Fortunato , like his countrymen , was a quack -- but in the matter of old wines he was sincere .
#Text=In this respect I did not differ from him materially : I was skillful in the Italian vintages myself , and bought largely whenever I could .
#Text=It was about dusk , one evening during the supreme madness of the carnival season , that I encountered my friend .
#Text=He accosted me with excessive warmth , for he had been drinking much .
#Text=The man wore motley .
#Text=He had on a tight-fitting parti-striped dress , and his head was surmounted by the conical cap and bells .
#Text=I was so pleased to see him , that I thought I should never have done wringing his hand .
#Text=I said to him -- "My dear Fortunato , you are luckily met .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= I have my doubts , " I replied ; " and I was silly enough to pay the full Amontillado price without consulting you in the matter .

_	_	_	_

#Text= Luchesi cannot tell Amontillado from Sherry .

_	_	_	_

#Text= My friend , no ; I will not impose upon your good nature .

column1: #Text=" It is farther on , " said I ; " but observe the white web-work which gleams from these cavern walls .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=He turned towards me , and looked into my eyes with two filmy orbs that distilled the rheum of intoxication .

#Text= Nitre ?

column1: #Text=" How long have you had that cough ?
#Text=" Come , " I said , with decision , " we will go back ; your health is precious .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= Enough , " he said ; " the cough is a mere nothing ; it will not kill me .

_	_	_	_

#Text= True -- true , " I replied ; " and , indeed , I had no intention of alarming you unnecessarily -- but you should use all proper caution .
